Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Players

Class TurnManager

java.lang.Object
Model.Players.TurnManager
public class TurnManager extends Object
The TurnManager class manages the sequence of turns for all players in the game. It handles advancing turns, tracking eliminated players, and maintaining a consistent order of play. This class ensures synchronization when accessing or modifying the turn state, so it can be safely used in a multithreaded environment where multiple player threads may interact simultaneously.
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • TurnManager

      public TurnManager(int totalPlayers)
      Constructs a TurnManager for a given number of players. Initializes the list of active turns and sets the turn iterator.
      Parameters:
      totalPlayers - total number of players participating in the game

  • Method Details

    • getActualTurn

      public int getActualTurn()
      Returns the current active turn identifier.
      Returns:
      the current player's turn number

    • passTurn

      public void passTurn()
      Advances the turn to the next player in the list. If the iterator reaches the end of the list, it loops back to the beginning. Eliminated players are automatically skipped, since they are removed from totalTurns.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by assigning the first turn to player 1.

    • setLasTurnEliminate

      public void setLasTurnEliminate(int lasTurnEliminate)
      Removes a player's turn from the active list when they are eliminated. This method also ensures that the iterator position remains valid after removal, preventing skipped or repeated turns.
      Parameters:
      lasTurnEliminate - the turn number corresponding to the eliminated player

    • getTotalTurns

      public ArrayList<Integer> getTotalTurns()
      Returns the list of all active player turns.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<Integer> containing the remaining player turns

    • getPlayersEliminate

      public int getPlayersEliminate()
      Returns the total number of players eliminated.
      Returns:
      the count of eliminated players

    • getTotalPlayers

      public int getTotalPlayers()
      Returns the total number of players at game start.
      Returns:
      the initial player count
